page.title: 12Typical Burgess Hill Day
page.content:
11 June, 1985, as experienced by a nine year old.
Daddy goes to work at 7.10 in a bank at London. I am still asleep. Mummy always wakes me up at 7.30. I get up, get dressed and have breakfast. I have Weetabix and a drink of milk. Then I go upstairs and get washed. I get my things ready for school. We get in the car and take Kirsty to her swimming lessons at 8.15. Mum works at Hassocks Pre-School Playgroup, so she leaves us with her friend who takes us to school. We go to school at 9.00 and come home at 3.30. When I get home I have a drink of milk and a biscuit. Then I do my homework and watch television. I play in my bedroom and help mum with the dinner and set the table.
